A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
With the clear intention of moving away from the Lucas Legacy\, this Director has consumated the machiavellian Disney's plan of turning SW saga in one size fits all current tendencies: ultra-feminism\, anti male\, ultra-diversification\, pro-millennial ranks...

And all of that could be achieved without destroting what has been the core of this epic fable: the story of the Skywalkers and the Jedi Order and its ways. 

In place of that Disney present us one story of a disgraced hermit Luke Skywalker that has forgotten all of his vows and virtues\, a movie where all the masculine figures are stupid\, malign\, flawed or plain "trouble-maker" and all feminine figures are virtuous\, heroic\, powerful\, merciful\, victorious. ..

Not a single figure that contradicts that...

Suddenly the Skywalkers are exctinct....the Jedi and its ways are useless... the Force can be tamed without a school (such a teenager dream)...

How disappointed I was with this movie...to the point of almost lose all interest in all SW related.
